msItem.title: Shahnamah
msItem.note: Folio 1a: Signature of David Price. F10a. Price's signature in Persian, beside numerous poor impressions of his Persian seal, with illegible date. First flyleaf, recto: a) Note, in French, seemingly recording presentation to Price, dated 18 Sept. 1793. b) Persian verses, evidently written by Price. Second flyleaf, a verse in Persian and a note in English, evidently written by Price. Back flyleaf, verso: Note, evidently by Price, concerning Firishtah's assertation that Asadi contributed to the Shahnamah. Ruled margins. Headings in red. Illuminated panels above opening of sections of the text, 25 late Mughal miniatures. Preface composed for Mirza Baisunqur.
msItem.incipit: Incipit. preface: Lahu al-mulk wa lahu al-hamd

layoutDesc.p: 22 lines to the page in four columns

bindingDesc.p: Brown leather Indian binding with stamped and painted decoration. The central stamp used on both covers bears the first line of Jami's Yusuf u Zulaikha.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
